docs.lead_paragraph: FREMONT, Mich.--John C. Suerth, chairman of the Gerber Products Com pany, was vacationing at his winter home in Naples, Fla., last April 15 when a visitor arrived--T.J. Barlow, chair man of Anderson, Clayton Company, the Houston producer of consumer and institutional foods. The two men had talked before, the first time at a food convention in June 1976, about a possi ble acquisition of Gerber by Anderson, Clayton.

headline.main: How Gerber Foiled a Takeover; How Gerber Foiled a Takeover

docs.abstract: owners of 3.5-million shares of common and preferred stock have tried since May '71 to get more for their shares than they were offered when co was taken private by Glen Alden Corp (M)
